content.question:
<math alttext="Seaborgium-263 with atomic number 106 produces Rutherfordium-259 with atomic number 104 plus helium-4 with atomic number 2" display="block" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mmultiscripts><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mprescripts></mprescripts><mrow><mn>106</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>263</mn></mrow></mmultiscripts><mo>→</mo><mmultiscripts><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>R</mi><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mprescripts></mprescripts><mrow><mn>104</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>259</mn></mrow></mmultiscripts><mo>+</mo><mmultiscripts><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>H</mi><mi>e</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mprescripts></mprescripts><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mmultiscripts></mrow></math>
Consider the decay of Seaborgium-263 <math alttext="open parenthesis mass equals 263.118322 u close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>s</mi><mi>s</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>263.118322</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi>u</mi></mrow></mstyle><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> that forms Rutherfordium-259 <math alttext="open parenthesis mass equals 259.105637 u close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>s</mi><mi>s</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>259.105637</mn></mrow></mstyle><mtext> </mtext><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>u</mi></mstyle><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and an alpha particle (a helium nucleus, <math alttext="open parenthesis mass equals 4.001506 u close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>m</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>s</mi><mi>s</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4.001506</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace></mrow></mstyle><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>u</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>), as shown in the reaction. How much energy is released in the reaction?

choices.label: <math alttext="10.41 mega-electron-volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10.41</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="3725.40 mega-electron-volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3725.40</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="237,501.95 mega-electron-volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>237</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>501.95</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="241,237.76 mega-electron-volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>241</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>237.76</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="10.41 mega-electron-volts" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10.41</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>V</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
